intro: Borreria capitata var. suaveolens, commonly known as sweet borreria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest understory habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are white to pale pink and have a subtle, sweet fragrance. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and unique scent.
